meanings.definition: Outcapers (verb): to surpass in capering or frolicking
meanings.sent1: The energetic puppy outcapers all the other dogs at the park.
meanings.sent2: She always outcapers her friends with her dance moves.
meanings.sent3: The clownfish outcapers the other fish with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The children outcapered the adults in the game of tag.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel outcapers the birds with its acrobatic leaps from tree to tree.

meanings.definition: Outcapers (noun): one who capers or frolics excessively
meanings.sent1: The little girl is known as the outcapers of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The outcapers at the party kept everyone entertained with their antics.
meanings.sent3: The outcapers in the play brought a lot of laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The outcapers in the group always make everyone smile with their playful nature.
meanings.sent5: The outcapers in the park brighten everyone's day with their joyful spirit.

meanings.definition: Outcapers (adjective): characterized by excessive capering or frolicking
meanings.sent1: The outcapers squirrel was a delight to watch in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The outcapers children filled the playground with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent3: The outcapers puppy made everyone in the family laugh with its playful behavior.
meanings.sent4: The outcapers dancers twirled and leaped across the stage with grace.
meanings.sent5: The outcapers kittens chased each other around the room, bringing smiles to everyone's faces.
